iiv.display

Interface ShowPointTracker

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ShowPointControllerInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ShowPointController, ShowPointDialog

    public interface ShowPointTracker
    ShowPointTracker defines methods for tracking values at a voxel location.
    Since:
    iiV1.1
    See Also:
    ShowPointImage, CNUDisplay

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCrosshairTracker(ShowPointImage spi)
      Adds a component to list of images that listens for crosshair positions with undo/redo.
      void addCrosshairTrackers(java.lang.Object[] objects)
      Adds an array of objects to list of crosshair trackers.
      void addSliceTracker(SliceNumbering tracker)
      Adds a component to list of images that tracks slice positions with undo/redo.
      boolean isCrosshairTracker(ShowPointImage spi)
      Queries whether a ShowPointImage is in the crosshair trackers list.
      boolean isSliceTracker(SliceNumbering tracker)
      Queries whether a SliceNumbering is in the slice trackers list.
      void restartComponentTrackers(java.lang.Object obj)
      Restarts trackers for components that where stopped using stopComponentTrackers.
      void setComponentCrosshair(ShowPointImage spi, ShowPointDisplay spd, int[] newIndices, java.awt.Color newColor, boolean undoFlag)
      Sets a components crosshair and displays the value in a ShowPointDialogLine while creating an undo/redo history.
      void setCrosshairs(ShowPointImage spi, int[] point)
      Sets the crosshair for current crosshair tracking images.
      void setMapTracking(boolean mapTracking)
      Sets whether show point lines track mapped location or point locations.
      java.lang.Object stopComponentTrackers(java.awt.Component[] components)
      Stops trackers for given components and returns an object that can be used to restart the trackers.
      void syncToCrosshairs()
      Sets the showPoint values to crosshair values for all currently listed images.
      void trackPoint(ShowPointImage spi, int[] point)
      Tracks and/or shows the point for all current tracking images.

      • stopComponentTrackers

        Stops trackers for given components and returns an object that can be used to restart the trackers.
        Returns:
        object that can be used to restart trackers

        Restarts trackers for components that where stopped using stopComponentTrackers.
        Parameters:

      • isSliceTracker

        boolean isSliceTracker(SliceNumbering tracker)
        Queries whether a SliceNumbering is in the slice trackers list.
        Parameters:
        tracker - SliceNumbering to check list for
        Returns:
        true if tracker is in list otherwise false

      • addSliceTracker

        void addSliceTracker(SliceNumbering tracker)
        Adds a component to list of images that tracks slice positions with undo/redo.
        Parameters:
        tracker - slice tracker to add to list

      • trackPoint

        void trackPoint(ShowPointImage spi,
                int[] point)
        Tracks and/or shows the point for all current tracking images.
        Parameters:
        spi - primary ShowPointImage to display point for
        point - array of indices specifying the point location

      • setMapTracking

        void setMapTracking(boolean mapTracking)
        Sets whether show point lines track mapped location or point locations.
        Parameters:
        mapTracking - true if lines track mapped location

        Returns:
        true if spi is in list otherwise false

      • addCrosshairTrackers

        void addCrosshairTrackers(java.lang.Object[] objects)
        Adds an array of objects to list of crosshair trackers.
        Parameters:

      • setCrosshairs

        void setCrosshairs(ShowPointImage spi,
                   int[] point)
        Sets the crosshair for current crosshair tracking images.
        Parameters:
        spi - primary ShowPointImage to set crosshair for
        point - array of indices specifying the point location

      • setComponentCrosshair

        void setComponentCrosshair(ShowPointImage spi,
                           ShowPointDisplay spd,
                           int[] newIndices,
                           java.awt.Color newColor,
                           boolean undoFlag)
        Sets a components crosshair and displays the value in a ShowPointDialogLine while creating an undo/redo history.
        Parameters:
        spi - ShowPointImage to set crosshair for. If null determines from spdl or returns
        spd - ShowPointDisplay to set values of If null determines from spi or ignores
        newIndices - Indices to set crosshair to
        newColor - Color to set crosshair to
        undoFlag - true to create undo/redo history

      • syncToCrosshairs

        void syncToCrosshairs()
        Sets the showPoint values to crosshair values for all currently listed images.
